benchmark_details.name: Instruction Contrastive Decoding (ICD)
benchmark_details.overview: The paper introduces a novel method to mitigate hallucinations in Large Vision-Language Models (LVLMs) during inference, aimed at improving their accuracy with respect to visual inputs through contrastive decoding.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To reduce hallucinations in LVLM inference, thereby improving the fidelity of generated content to the visual inputs.
audience: Practitioners in AI and Machine Learning
tasks: Mitigation of hallucinations in multimodal models
Enhancement of perception and recognition capabilities

methodology.calculation: Token probabilities are derived from the contrast between the original and disturbance instruction distributions.
methodology.interpretation: IMarchored responses are evaluated based on their fidelity to provided visual contexts.
methodology.baseline_results: ICD outperforms baseline LVLM methods such as miniGPT4 and InstructBLIP.
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments on benchmarks POPE, MME, and LLaVa-Bench.
